course.subject: UROP
course.name: Undergraduate Research Opportunities Series 1
course.description: This is the first course of a three-course series under the Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program (UROP). The series enables a student to complete a faculty-led research project that can possibly span three terms. UROP 1100 is the first course of such a project series. For projects that span more than one term, successful completion of UROP 1100 is a pre-requisite for proceeding to UROP 2100 of the same project; successful completion of UROP 2100 is a pre-requisite for proceeding to UROP 3100. Approval by faculty supervisor(s) is required. Students are required to submit a written report upon completion of each course. May be repeated for credit under a different project. Graded P or F.

reviews.author: tianyu
reviews.title: What am I doing
reviews.comment_content: NO Content. Yes I am not kidding. After I enrolled in this UROP project, he passed me to his student and gave me some deep learning sources, which is, some online lecture videos on Bilibili. After that, I cannot find him anymore. The final paper is totally done with my own AI knowledge learned in comp2211 ( Desmond!). Oh, btw my project is about image classification using AI ( cant tell u more detail).
reviews.comment_teaching: My AI knowledge came from Desmond so I would give an A. LOL.
reviews.comment_workload: Basically no workload. The week before due day, I suddenly received an email from UROP dept reminding me to submit my paper and I was like "Wait, what? When did I enroll in this UROP and what is my paper about?" I found my groupmate(another victum) to start writing our paper. She search online, finding some paper and reaserch, and write the abstract, intro... And I made use of my CNN knowledge to build a model. Luckily, we are CS students with high CGA so it was quite easy to do it ( hold on, I now know why he asked for my CGA before the enrollment). It spends me one day to build and train and evalute the model. I just spend less than 2 hours to finish my paper.
